Html: Currently, it does not support EDIFACT.  If this is a need, please let us know the transaction sets you work with the most and if you are willing submit test files.
This is an awesome library and it would not be complete without EDIFACT support; I got test files if you require any.

I agree, I researched this a few years ago and I think the main difference would be a slightly different set of control segments and then being able to embed the transaction set specifications for EDIFACT. Do you have a link to the latest standard sets that are currently in use?

Hello, From this official site I found a link for UN/EDIFACT-ISO9735 which lead me to this website http://www.gefeg.com/jswg/. There I believe the information your looking for exist. I am a newbie to X12 and EDIFACT so I can’t be much of help, still trying to wrap my head around it. Geovani Martinez
Hello,

From this official site I found a link for UN/EDIFACT-ISO9735 which lead me to this website http://www.gefeg.com/jswg/. There I believe the information your looking for exist. I am a newbie to X12 and EDIFACT so I can’t be much of help, still trying to wrap my head around it.





Geovani Martinez

Just curious, is EDIFACT support something you are still considering? Found this library last week and am very pleased with the functionality and usability. However, we also use EDIFACT (currently only for purchase orders) and it would be great to be able to utilize this library for ASC X12 and EDIFACT.
